author: Alexander NÃ¤hle
title: Das bittere Aus in der sechsten Minute der Nachspielzeit: ASC 09 wirft SÃ¶lde aus dem Pokal
text: Startseite Dortmund Sport Das bittere Aus in der sechsten Minute der Nachspielzeit: ASC 09 wirft SÃ¶lde aus dem Pokal Das bittere Aus in der sechsten Minute der Nachspielzeit ASC 09 wirft SÃ¶lde aus dem Pokal Alexander NÃ¤hle Freier Mitarbeiter 01.05.2025 06:00 Uhr Teilen In Merkliste Ã¼bernehmen Der VfR SÃ¶lde kÃ¤mpfte aufopferungsvoll gegen den haushohen Favoriten ASC 09. Â© Nils Foltynowicz Bitterer geht es nicht! Landesligist VfR SÃ¶lde war der Pokal-Sensation gegen Oberligist ASC 09 ganz nahe. In der sechsten Minute der Nachspielzeit dann das Aus. 2 Min Lesezeit Marcel MÃ¶ller hadert mit Gegentreffer Zur Startseite

author: /cronologia/-/meta/redaccion
title: ENEE declara en estado de emergencia por ola de calor
text: TEGUCIGALPA, HONDURAS.- El Centro Nacional de Despacho (CND) de la Empresa Nacional de EnergÃ­a ElÃ©ctrica (ENEE) ha declarado en estado de emergencia el Sistema Interconectado Nacional (SIN) en Honduras. La medida, que estarÃ¡ vigente por 48 horas, fue comunicada a travÃ©s de un comunicado emitido por el ente. La decisiÃ³n se fundamenta en la intensa ola de calor que afecta al paÃ­s, asÃ­ como en la prolongada sequÃ­a que impacta la regiÃ³n. Estos fenÃ³menos han generado condiciones extraordinarias en el sistema elÃ©ctrico nacional. El comunicado del CND, difundido en las redes sociales, explicÃ³ que la combinaciÃ³n de la ola de calor y la sequÃ­a ha provocado un aumento en el sobrecalentamiento y la sobrecarga de circuitos y transformadores. AdemÃ¡s, la densa capa de humo presente en varios departamentos del paÃ­s ha ocasionado la disminuciÃ³n de la generaciÃ³n fotovoltaica. SegÃºn indicÃ³ la ENEE, el 97% de la generaciÃ³n eÃ³lica tambiÃ©n se ha visto afectada, y mÃ¡s de 150 MW de generaciÃ³n tÃ©rmica estÃ¡n fuera de servicio debido a los daÃ±os ocasionados por las altas temperaturas. El comunicado concluyÃ³ con un llamado a la comprensiÃ³n por parte de la poblaciÃ³n, solicitando entender los desafÃ­os derivados de la crisis climÃ¡tica que tambiÃ©n ha impactado en los sistemas elÃ©ctricos de otros paÃ­ses de la regiÃ³n, como MÃ©xico, Costa Rica, Guatemala, Ecuador, Puerto Rico, Colombia y RepÃºblica Dominicana. En publicaciones previas, la estatal pidiÃ³ a los abonados tomar algunas medidas orientadas a hacer un uso consciente de la energÃ­a: 1.Reducir el uso de aparatos elÃ©ctricos entre las 6:30 p.m. y 9:30p.m. 2. Ajustar la temperatura del aire acondicionado a 23Â°. 3. Apaga luces innecesarias y utiliza focos LED.

author: @devilstower
title: Democrats are blowing up House GOP efforts to take down Biden
text: By now, anyone tuning into a House Oversight Committee or House Judiciary Committee hearing knows what to expect. With frequent slams of the gavel by their respective chairs, Republicans plod through repetitive attacks on President Joe Biden or waggle their fingers about some salacious claim including the phrase â€œHunter Bidenâ€™s laptop.â€ Democrats try to object and occasionally insert a fact. But the next Republican is at the mic five minutes later, once again hammering the same lies. At least thatâ€™s how it used to be. But anyone who has tuned in recently may have noticed a big change. Democrats arenâ€™t just tearing Republican arguments apart: Theyâ€™re derailing hearings and getting their opponents genuinely flustered. The recent hearing in which Republicans intended to charge Hunter Biden with contempt for declining to testify behind closed doors is a good example. Not only did Hunter make a brief personal appearance and offer to testify right then and there in public, but Democrats were able to consistently throw Republicans off their game, blow away false evidence, expose their hypocrisy, and even hammer Donald Trump. If all that seemed like it took a lot of behind-the-scenes planning, it did. But it wonâ€™t be the last time. Because as The Daily Beast reports, Democrats have a plan to make these hearings just as silly as the claims Republicans are making about Biden. As soon as they gained control of the House in 2023, Republicans launched a series of supposed investigations into President Biden. And his children. And his brother. And anyone else they can lump in to the â€œBiden Family Investigation.â€ For months, Rep. James Comer, who is heading up investigations in the House Oversight Committee, and Rep. Jim Jordan, who has the same role for the House Judiciary Committee, have been releasing false claims and mischaracterizing innocuous issues like a father loaning his son money for a car payment. But Republicans didnâ€™t let having zero evidence stop them from announcing an impeachment inquiry in December. The investigations have a clear goal: to reduce Bidenâ€™s chances of reelection and to signal to Trump that theyâ€™re trying to get revenge for his two impeachments. Republicans likely feel like these endless investigations worked well for them before the 2016 elections, when they spent two full years hectoring former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton about Benghazi. But this time around, the whole thing, whether itâ€™s Republicans badgering an art dealer who sold some of Hunterâ€™s paintings, a disappearing informant, or flashing revenge porn on the floor of the House, has been ridiculous from start to finish. The House GOP has been on a year-long fishing expedition featuring a level of obsession that would embarrass Captain Ahab, and they havenâ€™t even found a minnow. As Republicans ramped up the Biden attacks, Democrats responded. Rep. Jamie Raskin put together a â€œTruth Squadâ€ that includes Reps. Greg Casar, Jasmine Crockett, Maxwell Frost, Daniel Goldman, and Jared Moskowitz. If some of those names sound familiar, itâ€™s because theyâ€™ve been front and center in disrupting Republican plans. It was Crockett who forcefully kicked off a confrontation with Rep. Nancy Mace who, on a committee where every Republican member is white, accused Hunter Biden and Democrats of engaging in â€œwhite privilege.â€ Crockett forced Mace to try and defend her indefensible remarks, and then Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez slammed the gate closed by pointing out how Mace voted to eliminate the House Subcommittee on Civil Rights. As The Daily Beast article highlights, Moskowitz was on hand with a poster showing a chummy photo of Trump and sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein when it seemed that Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene was going to once again show nude pictures of Hunter Biden. â€œYou come up here and talk about Hunter Bidenâ€™s behavior and youâ€™re so disgusted,â€ said Moskowitz, â€œbut the guy that you all kneel to associates himself with a pedophile.â€ Those quick responses, along with Hunter Biden staring down Republicans from the visitor section, became the most viral moments from the hearing. Put together with sharp responses from other Democrats who refused to play Comerâ€™s game, Republicans were left looking like this: MAGAt House hearing. A picture is worth 1 MILLION words. EVERY hearing Comer has had, has been a disaster. Hunter Biden showed up at the hearing and spooked the MAGAts. Then they got a tongue lashing from @RepRaskin @RepJaredMoskowitz @RepJasmine Comer knew it was a disaster! pic.twitter.com/mRSCu5am0jâ€” Charm | DEMOCRATS deliver & NO CHAOS! ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡² ðŸ’™ðŸŒŠ (@CharmRobinson3) January 10, 2024 MAGAt House hearing. A picture is worth 1 MILLION words. EVERY hearing Comer has had, has been a disaster. Hunter Biden showed up at the hearing and spooked the MAGAts. Then they got a tongue lashing from @RepRaskin @RepJaredMoskowitz @RepJasmine Comer knew it was a disaster! pic.twitter.com/mRSCu5am0j The best thing to come from all this is that Raskin and the Democrats have been joined by a new set of critics attacking Comer and his pointless investigation. As Kerry Eleveld reported earlier, Republicans are none too happy that this absurd â€œinvestigationâ€ has gone on so long and come up so dry. â€œJames Comer continues to embarrass himself and House Republicans. He screws up over and over and over," said a source identified as "close" to House GOP leadership, who appeared to be playing CYA for the leadership team. The source's big fear was that Comer would ultimately fail to provide the foundation necessary (i.e. evidence) to follow through with impeaching Biden. These anonymous Republicans donâ€™t seem to be seriously considering that maybe Comer is failing not because heâ€™s incompetent (or at least, not only because heâ€™s incompetent) but because Joe Biden did nothing wrong. But then, they are Republicans. Theyâ€™re used to having leaders whose closets are jam-packed with skeletons. Republicans are trying to repeat their perceived success with Benghazi, but this time Democrats know the game and they have a plan to disrupt it. That plan isnâ€™t necessarily convincing Republicans that Biden did nothing wrong, but it sure is making these hearings more fun to watch.

author: @footnational
title: Coupe de France : Cannes "ravi" de recevoir Dives-Cabourg lors des 8es de finale
text:
Aris Djennadi
Coupe de France : Cannes "ravi" de recevoir Dives-Cabourg lors des 8es de finale
L'AS Cannes (N2) se rÃ©jouit de recevoir Dives-Cabourg (N3) lors des 8es de finale de la Coupe de France.
L'AS Cannes (N2) se rÃ©jouit de recevoir Dives-Cabourg (N3) lors des 8es de finale de la Coupe de France.
Une belle fÃªte pour le football amateur. La FÃ©dÃ©ration FranÃ§aise de Football (FFF), qui organise la compÃ©tition, a effectuÃ© le tirage au sort des 8es de finale de la Coupe de France. L'AS Cannes (National 2) va recevoir le Sport Union Dives-Cabourg (National 3) le mardi 4 ou le mercredi 5 fÃ©vrier. La rencontre, qui sera Ã  suivre en direct sur Foot-National, se jouera au stade Pierre-de-Coubertin. Le vainqueur sera qualifiÃ© pour les quarts de finale de la 108Ã¨me Ã©dition de la Vieille Dame.
Dans une interview accordÃ©e Ã  l'Ã‰quipe, FÃ©licien Laborde se rÃ©jouit de recevoir le Sport Union Dives-Cabourg (National 3). Le directeur gÃ©nÃ©ral du pensionnaire du groupe A du championnat National 2 espÃ¨re que son Ã©quipe validera son ticket pour le prochain tour de la plus belle des compÃ©titions de football en France : "On est ravis. C'est l'occasion de refaire une belle fÃªte avec nos supporters. Jouer chez nous, c'est ce qu'il y a de plus important, pour continuer Ã  faire progresser l'Ã©quipe, ce qui est notre but. Cette Coupe de France nous permet cela. On a dÃ©marrÃ© au troisiÃ¨me tour. On a une dynamique. Quel que soit l'adversaire, le but sera de prÃ©parer le match le mieux possible pour que l'Ã©quipe progresse. Si cela donnera une pression d'Ãªtre le favori pour la rencontre ? On a un groupe qui travaille bien, qui prend du plaisir, qui a le sourire aux lÃ¨vres. Le match contre Dives-Cabourg sera difficile. Mais je sais que je peux compter sur les joueurs, sur Cheikh Ndoye (le capitaine), sur notre entraÃ®neur Damien Ott, pour faire un match sÃ©rieux, comme je l'espÃ¨re on aura fait juste avant en Championnat, et comme on le fera juste aprÃ¨s."
Dans une interview accordÃ©e Ã  l'Ã‰quipe, FÃ©licien Laborde se rÃ©jouit de recevoir le Sport Union Dives-Cabourg (National 3) lors des 8es de finale de la Coupe de France. Le directeur gÃ©nÃ©ral de l'AS Cannes du championnat National 2 espÃ¨re que son Ã©quipe validera son ticket pour le prochain tour.

author: Maya Boddie
title: 'Weâ€™re not going to help': GOP sheriff candidates in Trumpâ€™s state reject his mass deportation plan
text:
'Weâ€™re not going to help': GOP sheriff candidates in Trumpâ€™s state reject his mass deportation plan
Picryl. Media
When TIME National Politics Reporter Eric Cortellessa asked Donald Trump in April how he plans to carry out the "largest deportation operation in American history" if elected in November,
the ex-president replied: "We will be using local law enforcement."
Local law enforcement candidates â€” both Democratic and GOP candidates backed by Trump â€” in Miami-Dade County, Florida, t
old Miami Herald in a recent interview that they don't plan to assist the former president with this plan.
"As far as Iâ€™m concerned, if the law stays the way it is, immigration stays in their lane and I stay in mine," Republican sheriff candidate and veteran police union boss John Rivera told the Florida newspaper.
READ MORE:
Americans are in denial about Trumpâ€™s 'dictator threats' and 'fascist language': historian
Miami Herald
reports:
A spokesperson for Trumpâ€™s campaign did not respond to the Heraldâ€™s request for comment on how he sees the role of local law enforcement in carrying out his mass-deportation promises. U.S. law states that federal officials canâ€™t deputize state or local law enforcement officers to carry out the work of federal immigration officers without permission from the agencyâ€™s head â€” like, for example, a sheriff. But even the candidate endorsed by Trump in the race â€” Rosanna Cordero-Stutz â€” said that she would only be willing to help federal immigration agents in limited circumstances.
The newspaper also notes:
Currently, the countyâ€™s Democratic mayor, Daniella Levine Cava, oversees the Miami-Dade Police Department, which would become the county Sheriffâ€™s Office in 2025. Florida rules also require partisan elections for sheriff, meaning Republican and Democratic voters will select their nominee for sheriff in the Aug. 20 primaries. Despite the partisan incentive of Republican candidates to align themselves with Trump, thereâ€™s a divide over immigration enforcement between the presumptive GOP nominee and Miami-Dadeâ€™s GOP sheriff candidates.
Candidates assert that participating in Trump's deportation ploy "would erode the communityâ€™s trust in law enforcement and pull officers away from their ultimate mission of ensuring public safety," the newspaper reports.
Florida Highway Patrol Trooper Joe Sanchez â€” who's also a GOP candidate â€” emphasized, "Weâ€™re not going to help the president on that one."
READ MORE:
'Danger to law enforcement': Jack Smith asks Judge Cannon to make Trump stop lying about FBI
GOP candidate Jose Aragu added, "Quite frankly, I donâ€™t think we have the time for that."
Miami Herald's full report is available
at this link. 'Not welcome here': Texas residents slam Trump as 'traitor' ahead of border trip â€º 'Disastrous consequences': Columnist warns this 'destructive' Trump plan could tank economy â€º Economic experts 'confident' a key component of Trumpâ€™s platform could spark a recession â€º

à¤µà¤¨ à¤µà¤¿à¤­à¤¾à¤— à¤•à¥€ à¤°à¥‡à¤¸à¥à¤•à¥à¤¯à¥‚ à¤Ÿà¥€à¤® à¤•à¥‡ à¤…à¤¨à¥à¤­à¤µà¥€ à¤¸à¤¦à¤¸à¥à¤¯ à¤œà¤¿à¤¤à¥‡à¤‚à¤¦à¥à¤° à¤¬à¤¿à¤·à¥à¤Ÿ à¤•à¥‡ à¤®à¥à¤¤à¤¾à¤¬à¤¿à¤•, à¤®à¤¾à¤¨à¤¸à¥‚à¤¨ à¤¶à¥à¤°à¥‚ à¤¹à¥‹à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥€ à¤¹à¤° à¤¦à¤¿à¤¨ à¤”à¤¸à¤¤à¤¨ 8 à¤¸à¥‡ 10 à¤•à¤¾à¤² à¤¸à¤¾à¤‚à¤ªà¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥€ à¤®à¥Œà¤œà¥‚à¤¦à¤—à¥€ à¤•à¥‹ à¤²à¥‡à¤•à¤° à¤† à¤°à¤¹à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚à¥¤ à¤‡à¤¨à¤®à¥‡à¤‚ à¤¸à¥‡ à¤•à¤ˆ à¤•à¤¾à¤² à¤à¤¸à¥‡ à¤…à¤¤à¥à¤¯à¤‚à¤¤ à¤œà¤¹à¤°à¥€à¤²à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤‚à¤ªà¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¹à¥‹à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚ à¤œà¥ˆà¤¸à¥‡ à¤­à¤¾à¤°à¤¤à¥€à¤¯ à¤•à¥‹à¤¬à¤°à¤¾ , à¤ªà¤¿à¤Ÿà¤µà¤¾à¤‡à¤ªà¤° à¤†à¤¦à¤¿à¥¤ à¤‰à¤¨à¥à¤¹à¥‹à¤‚à¤¨à¥‡ à¤¬à¤¤à¤¾à¤¯à¤¾ à¤•à¤¿ à¤•à¤ˆ à¤¬à¤¾à¤° à¤ªà¤¾à¤¨à¥€ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¬à¤¹à¤¾à¤µ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤¾à¤¥ à¤œà¤²-à¤¸à¤°à¥à¤ª à¤­à¥€ à¤°à¤¿à¤¹à¤¾à¤¯à¤¶à¥€ à¤‡à¤²à¤¾à¤•à¥‹à¤‚ à¤¤à¤• à¤ªà¤¹à¥à¤‚à¤š à¤œà¤¾à¤¤à¥‡ à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚, à¤œà¤¿à¤¸à¤¸à¥‡ à¤¸à¥à¤¥à¤¿à¤¤à¤¿ à¤”à¤° à¤­à¥€ à¤—à¤‚à¤­à¥€à¤° à¤¹à¥‹ à¤œà¤¾à¤¤à¥€ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤ à¤œà¤¿à¤¨ à¤‡à¤²à¤¾à¤•à¥‹à¤‚ à¤®à¥‡à¤‚ à¤œà¤²à¤­à¤°à¤¾à¤µ à¤…à¤§à¤¿à¤• à¤¹à¥ˆ à¤¯à¤¾ à¤œà¥‹ à¤œà¤‚à¤—à¤² à¤”à¤° à¤¨à¤¾à¤²à¥‹à¤‚ à¤•à¥‡ à¤¸à¤®à¥€à¤ª à¤¹à¥ˆà¤‚, à¤µà¤¹à¤¾à¤‚ à¤–à¤¤à¤°à¤¾ à¤”à¤° à¤­à¥€ à¤¬à¤¢à¤¼ à¤œà¤¾à¤¤à¤¾ à¤¹à¥ˆà¥¤
